wikipedia_page.main: Carrie Nicole Prideaux (née Davis; born 24 June 1976) in Barnstaple, England) is a sportsreader who previously worked for the BBC News Channel, best known for reading the sports news on The Chris Moyles Show on BBC Radio 1.

response: *Carrie Davis - sports reader and regular contributor (2004-2010)
Previous sports reporters include Arlo White, David Garrido, Juliette Ferrington, Mark Chapman, Tina Daheley, and Carrie Davis.

link_mentions.page: List of people with surname Davis

response: | align="center" rowspan="2" | Day 3 || Fri 06:30 – 10:00|| The Chris Moyles Show team || Carrie Davis (former Newsbeat sports newsreader) (by phone) Gary BarlowRicky WilsonJayne Sharpand Chris and Dave's friends and family.  || Gary Presented the Guinness World Record Certificate to Chris and Dave shortly after breaking the record || £1,808,424 (08:40)
**October – Carrie Davis joins, and starts reading her first ever Newsbeat sports bulletins for The Chris Moyles Show
**12 February – Carrie Davis leaves the station after reading her last Newsbeat sports bulletins for The Chris Moyles Show, to work for BBC Sport.

**15 February – Tina Daheley joins the station and replaces Carrie Davis on Newsbeat sports bulletins for The Chris Moyles Show, and later hosts news, sport and weather bulletins for Radio 1 Breakfast with Nick Grimshaw from 24 September 2012.
